results.text: Group Relative Policy Optimization In order to save the training costs of RL, we adopt Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) (Shao et al., 2024), which foregoes the critic model that is typically the same size as the policy model, and estimates the baseline from group scores instead. Specifically, for each question ğ‘, GRPO samples a group of outputs {ğ‘œ1, ğ‘œ2, Â· Â· Â· , ğ‘œğº} from the old policy ğœ‹ğœƒğ‘œğ‘™ğ‘‘ and then optimizes the policy model ğœ‹ğœƒ by maximizing the following objective:
